data.title: The 70 Best NBA Atlanta Hawks Shooting Guards
data.meta_description: Over 200 sports fans have voted on the 70 Best NBA Atlanta Hawks Shooting Guards. Current Top 3: Pete Maravich, Joe Johnson, Steve Smith
data.text:
Ranked By

1.2K votes

266 voters

3 reranks

Voting Rules

Vote up the players who had the most success for the Atlanta Hawks

Big fan of Atlanta basketball? Then check out this list of Atlanta Hawks shooting guards. It includes almost every shooting guard from throughout Atlanta Hawks history, including current shooting guards and past ones. Featuring some of the greatest NBA shooting guards of all time, the best Hawks SGs include Steve Smith, Pete Maravich, Joe Johnson, and Lou Hudson.

In the 2021-22 NBA season, the current Atlanta Hawks starting SGs and backup SGs are Bogdan Bogdanovic, Kevin Huerter, and Lou Williams.

Who are the best shooting guards in Atlanta Hawks history? Vote below and help decide the greatest Atlanta Hawks shooting guard of all time!

Most divisive: Jim Jackson

Over 200 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The 70 Best NBA Atlanta Hawks Shooting Guards

Birthplace : Aliquippa, Pennsylvania

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Boston Celtics, Utah Jazz, Atlanta Hawks, New Orleans Jazz

Position : Shooting guard

Atlanta Hawks: 1970–1974

Pete Maravich, a prodigious shooting guard with unmatched flair and scoring ability, joined the Atlanta Hawks as a rookie in 1970 after being drafted third overall. Known for his incredible ball-handling skills and creative passing, "Pistol Pete" was a five-time NBA All-Star and four-time All-NBA Team selection during his tenure with the Hawks. Though he never won a championship, Maravich's legacy as one of the greatest shooting guards in Hawks history is unquestionable, immortalized by his number 44 jersey retired by the team. To this day, his name remains synonymous with the essence of basketball artistry and showmanship.

Birthplace : Little Rock, Arkansas

Nationality : American

Team : Phoenix Suns, Atlanta Hawks, Brooklyn Nets, Miami Heat, Utah Jazz

Position : Shooting guard

Atlanta Hawks: 2005–2012

The Atlanta Hawks franchise acquired Joe Johnson in 2005 via trade from the Phoenix Suns, securing themselves an elite shooter and consistent scorer in the process. Johnson's cool demeanor and proficiency in knocking down long-range shots earned him the nickname "Iso Joe," as he routinely converted isolation plays into buckets with ease. During his tenure with the Hawks, he was a six-time NBA All-Star and one-time All-NBA Third Team selection. His marksmanship and clutch performances solidified his place as one of the premier shooting guards in Atlanta Hawks history.

Birthplace : Detroit, Highland Park, Michigan

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Shooting guard

Atlanta Hawks: 1994–1999

Originally drafted by the Miami Heat, Steve Smith found his way to the Atlanta Hawks in a 1994 trade. A versatile and well-rounded player, Smith's combination of size, basketball IQ, and shooting ability made him a potent offensive threat. He was named an NBA All-Star in 1998 and, in the same year, also garnered All-NBA Third Team honors for his outstanding play. The lasting impact of Smith's contributions to the team has earned him a place among the all-time great Atlanta Hawks shooting guards.

Birthplace : Greensboro, North Carolina

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Shooting guard, Small forward

Atlanta Hawks: 1966–1977

Lou Hudson, affectionately known as "Sweet Lou," joined the Atlanta Hawks after being drafted fourth overall in 1966. A smooth shooter with a deadly mid-range game, Hudson quickly became an offensive juggernaut for the team. Over the course of his time in Atlanta, he was a six-time NBA All-Star and amassed over 16,000 career points. Hudson's contributions to the franchise continue to be celebrated, as he remains firmly entrenched in the pantheon of great Atlanta Hawks shooting guards.

Birthplace : Seattle, Washington

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Chicago Bulls, New York Knicks, Golden State Warriors, Atlanta Hawks, Portland Trail Blazers

Position : Point guard, Shooting guard

Atlanta Hawks: 2009–2011

Jamal Crawford, also known as "J-Crossover," began his Atlanta Hawks journey in 2009 following a trade from the Golden State Warriors. A lethal scorer with a penchant for dazzling dribbling displays and clutch shots, Crawford quickly became a fan favorite. He garnered the NBA Sixth Man of the Year award in 2010 during his time with the Hawks, thanks to his remarkable ability to light up the scoreboard off the bench. His penchant for game-winning shots and silky-smooth playstyle endears him as one of the most memorable shooting guards to have donned the Atlanta jersey.

Birthplace : Lakewood, California

Nationality : United States of America

Team : New Jersey Nets

Position : Shooting guard, Small forward

Atlanta Hawks: 2012–2017

Acquired from the Chicago Bulls in a 2012 trade, Kyle Korver immediately made a significant impact on the Atlanta Hawks. A consummate sharpshooter with exceptional range, Korver's ability to space the floor and knock down three-pointers at a high clip was invaluable to the team's success. In 2015, he earned his first and only NBA All-Star selection while also setting an NBA record for the highest single-season three-point shooting percentage. Korver's time in Atlanta is fondly remembered and has cemented his status as one of the most lethal long-range shooters in franchise history.
